title: (x) Shadowed grotesque in Tate ETC. magazine - Sans Serif Shaded {Brown Fox}
content:
Does anybody know whci font is this one?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [thereiamnexttome.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021124312/http:/typophile.com/files/thereiamnexttome.jpg) | 54.63 KB |

 [‹ (x) serif type in Swiss DU magazine - DU Serif (customised Palatino) {FlorianCH (Raph)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021124312/http:/typophile.com/node/30500 "Go to previous forum topic") [text face from "Jeremias" by Stefan Zweig, German book published by Insel-Verlag in 1919 ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021124312/http:/typophile.com/node/30519 "Go to next forum topic")
author: manukball

comments.content:
Tate ETC. a lovely magazine, isn’t it!  
The typeface is called “Sans Serif Shaded” by William Thorowgood.
